title: For just $23--the cost of a bourbon bottle--the Jim Beam Stillhouse is being rented for first time
text:
Advertisement

It is the ideal vacation for lovers of bourbon - and it won't cost more then a bottle of Jim Beam to stay there.

The famous family have decided to rent out the Stillhouse at their distillery in Kentucky on Airbnb for only $23 a night.

For the first time, the it is open to customers of legal drinking age, from October 21 until the end of the year.

A vintage looking home, the Jim Beam American Stillhouse was built in 2012

The rental package includes a distillery tour and tasting, experiencing the entire bourbon production process.

For the first time, Jim Beam is opening its doors to visitors, listing its first-ever rental property on Airbnb. This is rustic looking living room with wood paneling, wood floors and a fireplace

The dining room at the Jim Beam American Stillhouse seats eight. Starting Oct. 21, visitors can spend the night and tour the famed Kentucky operation

A look at one of bedrooms available for rent on the grounds of Jim Beam headquarters in Kentucky

A fully-stocked bar awaits guests at the Jim Bean American Stillhouse, now taking rental reservations

From the fresh tile to the new appliances, guests get a working kitchen as part of their visit to Jim Beam American Stillhouse

The Jim Beam house rental includes a tasting and tour of the bourbon making process

Fred Noe, seventh-generation master distiller, is listed as rental host on the Jim Beam grounds

Visitors check out a tasting room on the distillery tour at Jim Beam in Kentucky

Jim Beam Bourbon is welcoming guests to its first-ever rental property in Kentucky

While the property goes back 100 years, the house was built in 2012 is a replica of a 1930s stillhouse with three bedrooms for guests and 2 1/2 baths.

Other amenities include free on-site parking, wifi, a kitchen and breakfast. Each room has a fireplace, backyard with cowboy cauldrons, nearby fishing docks, and of course a fully-stocked bar with premium Jim Beam bourbons.

The Airbnb listing says the original Prohibition era staircase is on display.

Other unique elements include an original staircase from the Jim Beam distillery circa Prohibition, a bourbon bar with seasonal cocktails and Fred’s Smokehouse, which serves bourbon BBQ selections that are inspired from Beam family recipes.

Fred Noe, the seventh-generation master distiller of Jim Beam and great-grandson of James B. Beam, is listed as rental host.
description: For $23 per night, guests can rent a room at the Jim Beam American Stillhouse, and get a tour of the world-famous facility. It's open for guests from Oct. 21 until the end of the year.
